title: Exclusive: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman on the Future of AGI
introText: In an exclusive interview, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman discusses the company's path to artificial general intelligence, the risks and opportunities ahead, and why he believes AI will ultimately benefit humanity.

content.content: Altman believes AGI—artificial general intelligence capable of performing any intellectual task—could arrive within five years. 'We're seeing capabilities emerge faster than even we expected,' he explains.
On safety, Altman is cautiously optimistic. 'We have more time to get this right than doomers suggest, but less time than techno-optimists believe. The next few years are critical.'
'AI should amplify human capability, not replace human purpose,' Altman concludes. 'The best outcomes require intentional choices about how we develop and deploy these systems.'
